body: We might be better off requiring JUnit >= 4.12 -- right?
... Since technically we only actively _support_ JUnit 4.12 at the moment.

Let's keep in mind that `junit-vintage-engine` has a required transitive dependency on `junit:junit:4.12` in its [pom.xml](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/junit/vintage/junit-vintage-engine/5.2.0/junit-vintage-engine-5.2.0.pom).

Thus if a version of JUnit < 4.12 shows up on the classpath (at least in a build), that would typically be caused by some user error.

> Thus if a version of JUnit < 4.12 shows up on the classpath (at least in a build), that would typically be caused by some user error.

True. The exception occured when a `junit:junit` artifact was found on the classpath and I tried to treat that as an indicator to include and enable the JUnit Vintage engine. Will add `:4.12+` to the indicator.

Providing a better error message would still be good.

> Will add `:4.12+` to the indicator.

Sounds good.

> Providing a better error message would still be good.

Yep, I agree: better diagnostics == better software, and I added the `diagnostics` label to this issue accordingly. ðŸ˜‰

issue.title: remove junit 3 provider code
issue.body:
### New feature, improvement proposal

junit before 4.12 is not supported anymore see https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/issues/1560
